title: Creeping Darkness
opening: The Caer Pelyn Range… According to Ewan, a little-known passage to Jehanna lies there, hidden within its cracked red bedrock and knife-edged peaks. To avoid Carcino and combat, Eirika’s troops take the mountain path. They begin climbing higher and higher toward Caer Pelyn. Unbeknownst to the group, hordes of dark creatures now roam the peaks.

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: We’re almost there! Come on! My teacher lives just up ahead.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Slow down, Ewan. Let’s stick together.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...This fog’s getting thick. I don’t expect any more surprise attacks, but that doesn’t mean we–

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: Quick worrying, mister! You’re gonna get left behind.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...Don’t speak to me, boy. I don’t tolerate insolence.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Innes, he’s only a child. There’s no reason to be so rude. He is helping us after all.

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: That’s right. Without me, you’d never get where you’re going. So come on already!

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Stop. Don’t take another step.

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: Huh? That’s gonna make it awfully hard to get where we need to go.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...What do you know about that fort? It looks like it’s been abandoned for some time. Is anyone using it?

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: Nope. It’s really run-down. Nobody ever goes there. It’s been empty for ages. I’ve been inside, so I know.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Is that right? Then what’s that sound, and where is it coming from?

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: Huh? What sound? Hey, you’re right... I do hear a weird noise. You could hear that? Neat! You’ve got really good hearing. I wonder what it is...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: There it is again. Prince, is this...

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Eirika.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Get your troops ready. Tell them to prepare for battle... We’ve been spotted. Monsters are coming.

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: Ewan, it’s dangerous here. Get behind me.

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: No way. I’m gonna fight too.

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: No. You’re too young. You’re not ready for this. Are you going to do as I say or not? I don’t know what I would do if you were to get injured.

intro.speaker: Ewan
intro.line: Oh...OK.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: What spacious chambers. Hm... A bit musty, but I like it. I’ve decided. We’ll bed here for the night. I do wonder where Rennac disappeared to, though. I told him not to wander off, but...

intro.speaker: Dozla
intro.line: Hmph! Lady L’Arachel, this could be trouble.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: What is it, Dozla?

intro.speaker: Dozla
intro.line: Look there! Through that break in the fog... Looks like we’ve got some nasty creatures running ’bout this place.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: ...I can’t see a thing. But this can be nothing but good fortune shining down on us again. Losing our way in the mountains and running into these abominations? There can be no doubt: we were brought here to destroy these foul things! Come, Dozla! We fight!

intro.speaker: Dozla
intro.line: Gwah ha ha! My heart cries out for battle!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Hello! So it’s true! Blessings do come in threes!

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: L’Arachel, this place is dangerous. You should find safe haven elsewhere.

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Oh, you needn’t worry about us. As you well know, my divine mission is to purge the land of these obscenities. I will show you the splendor that is L’Arachel in action! Bear witness!

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: If you insist. At least let us join forces for the time being.

recruit-talk.speaker: Dozla
recruit-talk.line: Gwah ha ha! What is it, Lady L’Arachel?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: We’re going to join these good people and eradicate these unclean monstrosities.

recruit-talk.speaker: Dozla
recruit-talk.line: Sounds fun! What would you have me to do?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Oh, just carry on in your normal manner: destroy, destroy, destroy. But do be sure to enjoy yourself.

recruit-talk.speaker: Dozla
recruit-talk.line: Gwah ha ha! I am your obedient servant!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Thank you, L’Arachel.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Please, speak nothing of it. It is heaven’s dictate that I come here to cleanse this charming place of monsters. What’s important is– Oh my! I just realized I have not yet had the honor of your name.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Oh, you’re right. How strange... We’ve met so often now that I had assumed you already... Please forgive my lack of manners. My name is Eirika.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Milady...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: It’s all right, Seth. She’s clearly not our enemy.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Eirika... Aha! So you must be Princess Eirika of Renais! It is simply an honor to meet you. And how strange that we should meet again in this place. You must be lost as well. This continent is so confusing.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Um, yes. Actually, we’re not lost at all. You see...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Is that so! Well, clearly, I must be allowed to accompany you.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: You want to travel with us? I appreciate your offer, but our journey is far too perilous. I do not wish to pull you into this madness.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: No, no, no. There can be no doubt that we were sent here to aid you. It is all part of the grand design. I, L’Arachel, shall play my role and fulfill my divine duties. This I swear!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Are you sure this is wise, Princess?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Don’t worry, Seth.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: ...Well, that’s that, Dozla. You and I are now traveling with Eirika and her companions.

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwah ha ha! I understand. For you, Lady L’Arachel, I would do absolutely anything! I would run to the ends of this world and dive into a sea of evil!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: How very like you, my dear, dedicated Dozla! So noble! Come! We’re off!

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwah ha ha!

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Teeeaaaacher... Hellooooooo... That’s strange. He’s not here. Must be out wandering again.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: He’s out? That poses a problem. Do you know when he’ll return?

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Hmmm... I don’t know. He often goes out and looks for people in need.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: ...I believe I told you it would be best to stay away.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: I’ve been charged with a mission and must depart again soon.

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Ah! Teacher!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Y-you... We’ve met before, haven’t we? You were looking for someone...

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: ...Oh, yes. And now we meet again.

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: These people say they want to go through Caer Pelyn. I could guide them myself, but I thought it might be better if you went, too. That’s why I brought them here. What do you say? Will you guide them?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Would you, please?

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: ...Very well. I’m heading there now. If you need to go to Caer Pelyn, you’re free to follow me.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: You don’t mind?

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: We have little interest in the outside world, but we do not refuse travelers. I should warn you: the road is not easy, and you look very weary. You should rest a night before attempting the mountains.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: We do need rest, it’s true. We are all exhausted from our encounter with those creatures. We must give our men time to heal, or they’ll be useless in an emergency.

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: It’s settled then. I’ll go on ahead and let the elder know we’re coming. See? Even when there’s no fighting to be done, I’m still useful!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No, wait! ...He’s gone. I wonder if he’ll be all right.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Idiotic boy. I understand his need to be helpful, but...

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Ewan knows this land well. You needn’t worry about him. We’ll depart at sunrise. I suggest you all get some rest.

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Princess Eirika of Renais. Hold.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Who? You.. You’re General Glen of Grado. We met once in the capital, didn’t we? You were very kind to me. However, if you’re here now, I have to assume this means...

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Yes, it does. I wish our reunion could come under different circumstances. Eirika, I must tell you, I come here on the direct orders of the emperor. I’m to bring to justice the rebel army leader who’s been terrorizing Carcino. It’s you, Eirika. They say you’ve been murdering innocents.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: What? Wait! What do you mean? I...

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: ...If you have something to say, I would hear it. I know all too well that Grado has robbed you of your homeland, but even so... I do not believe revenge could drive a woman like you to such depths. And yet... here you are in Carcino with a small army under your command. And the emperor tells us that you massacred everyone in Port Kiris.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That... That’s a lie! I could never...

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Go on.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: ...This is ridiculous. Believe what you want. Could one of the legendary Imperial Three honestly be as stupid as this?

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: ...What do you mean?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Carcino betrayed Frelia and set a pack of mercenary dogs to kill me. And you paint Eirika a rebel instigator? It’s an absurd farce. Your emperor commits horrors, and you believe Eirika is a criminal?

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: ...What are you saying?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: You truly are blind, aren’t you? You’re one of the Imperial Three, and yet you can’t see your emperor’s plan?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That’s enough, Innes. There’s no need to provoke him. General Glen, we’ve told you what we know to be true, what we’ve seen firsthand. We don’t want to fight you... But if you push us, we will drive you back to Grado with your tail between your legs.

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: ...I see. You...are more observant than you know. I am ignorant of the emperor’s designs. General Duessel and I both questioned the wisdom of this war. And if you really are innocent of the crimes attributed to you... Why would His Majesty lie to us? I must know the answer.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: So, you...believe us?

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: The Princess Eirika I met long ago was kind and merciful in spirit. You’ve faced relentless hardship, and yet that selfsame spirit remains true. ...Let’s put our fight aside for now. I will learn the truth. Then I will once again perform the duties of my office. If you have lied to me today, I will hound you to the very grave itself.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Very well...

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Glen. Where do you think you’re going?

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Valter...

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Tsk, tsk. What am I to make of this? Those little birds I saw flitting away into the mountains looked vaguely familiar. What do you suppose would happen if it were known you let Eirika escape?

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Do as you will. I’m returning to the capital. I have questions for the emperor. Clear the path, Valter.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Hold on now. No reason to rush off, is there? After all, this is where you’re going to die. See?

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: ...What are you babbling about?

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Heh heh... We were a grand trio–the Imperial Three: You, Duessel, and me. But my place among you was stolen, and I was exiled from Grado.

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: You slaughtered people who had no intention of fighting. The emperor’s punishment was just and warranted.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Heh heh...heh heh heh... After my fall from glory, only desire kept me alive. Desire for revenge. My hatred burned so fierce that I was only barely able to keep my sanity. That hatred keeps me warm still today. Oh, how it burns...

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Hear me, Glen, wyvern general of the Imperial Three. I live for battle. I crave it. I have no need for peace. That is why you must die.

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Cur! You’re mad!

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: A battle between generals... Sends the spirit soaring, eh? Come, Glen! Entertain me! Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

end.speaker: Glen
end.line: Urrgh...

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Go. The small fish are yours.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Heh heh... This is merely the beginning. Endless battle, war without end... Heh heh... ha hahahahahaha!
